snippet: India, whose once red-hot economy has started to cool, is trying to cope with debt and deficit problems that will put strains on the annual budget to be presented to Parliament on Friday.
abstract: India, whose once red-hot economy has started to cool, is trying to cope with debt and deficit problems that will put strains on the annual budget; non-performing loans are an issue for country's private and public sector banks, but the problem has grown worse for the government banks

byline.contributor: Heather Timmons contributed reporting from New Delhi and Neha Thirani from Mumbai.

lead_paragraph: India, whose once red-hot economy has started to cool, is trying to cope with debt and deficit problems that will put strains on the annual budget to be presented to Parliament on Friday.

headline.main: Bad Loans at State-Run Banks Add to India’s Woes
headline.print_headline: Bad Loans at State-Run Banks Add to India’s Woes
